THE FORD FOUNDATION
477 MADISON AVENUE
NEW YORK 22, N. Y.
March 4.
Mr. sUchard B. Hull
Ofeaftmaa NAEB Fowidatlon Committee
14 Gregory Hall '
Urban*. Illinois
Dear Dicks
for your good note of March 1st. I shall ho
happy to talk with any or all of you about the HAEB sUu-
atlon at your convenience. 1 am also glad to have word
about the projected meeting late in May which you are
planning to hold. So far aa 1 know the three day* you have
•elected do not conflict with any other commitment® at*
though there ie a possibility that 1 may have to be out of
the country at that time.
At a risk of being a bore I can only reiterate one of
the observations which 1 made to you when you were in the
office a few days ago. Wish respect to the meeting I should
say that 1 am much less concerned with the auspices and
the mechanics of invitations and sponsorship than I am with
what may bo accomplished therefrom. Whether or not the
meeting is a success seems to me to depend on whether
or not the agenda is addressed to fimdamentals more
whether specific organisations or indesd even individuals
participate.
It was good to have the opportunity to talk with you
and 1 trust that it will not be so long before we get together
again.
Sincerely*
cc: Burton Paulu
Frank Schooley
Henry Cheydeyne
James Miles
Harry Skornia —
